intro: Goniothalamus cardiopetalus, commonly known as the heart-petal tree, is a member of the Annonaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in lowland tropical rainforests. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers with a distinctive heart-shaped petal arrangement. Its fruit is a berry that turns from green to red when mature, containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
